qas.question: The first American to orbit around the planet was whom?
When did John Glenn orbit the Earth?
Where did John Glenn land on Earth after coming back from orbit?
John Glenn's spaceship was named what when he orbited the Earth?

context: American Virgil "Gus" Grissom repeated Shepard's suborbital flight in Liberty Bell 7 on July 21, 1961. Almost a year after the Soviet Union put a human into orbit, astronaut <a0_0>John Glenn<a0_0/> became the first American to orbit the Earth, on <a1_0>February 20, 1962<a1_0/>. His Mercury-Atlas 6 mission completed three orbits in the <a3_0>Friendship 7<a3_0/> spacecraft, and splashed down safely in the <a2_0>Atlantic Ocean<a2_0/>, after a tense reentry, due to what falsely appeared from the telemetry data to be a loose heat-shield. As the first American in orbit, Glenn became a national hero, and received a ticker-tape parade in New York City, reminiscent of that given for Charles Lindbergh. On February 23, 1962, President Kennedy escorted him in a parade at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, where he awarded Glenn with the NASA service medal.
